intro: Stilbocarpa, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, and its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green in color. Stilbocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
